title: How to Change Windows Logon Screen

steps.title: Open the Start menu.
steps.content: Open the Start menu. Do this either by clicking the Windows logo in the bottom-left corner of the screen, or by pressing your computer's ⊞ Win key.

steps.title: Click Settings .
steps.content: Click Settings . It's the gear icon near the bottom-left corner of the Start menu.

steps.title: Click Personalization.
steps.content: Click Personalization . This icon looks like a computer monitor with a paint brush.

steps.title: Click Lock screen.
steps.content: Click Lock screen . It's a tab on the left side of the window. Although the majority of settings on this screen are for the lock screen (the screen that appears before you get to the screen that allows you to enter your passcode), you can make it so the same background image appears on both screens.

steps.title: Select Picture from the "Background" menu.
steps.content: Select Picture from the "Background" menu. This drop-down menu is below the image of your existing background. This lets you choose a specific image from your computer to appear on both the lock screen and the sign-in screen.

steps.title: Click Browse.
steps.content: Click Browse . It's below the sample photos in the middle of the screen. If you don't want to choose one of your own photos, you can choose one of the samples.

steps.title: Select a photo and click Choose picture.
steps.content: Select a photo and click Choose picture . This can be any photo on your computer, although a high-resolution photo will look better on the lock screen than will a low-resolution one.

steps.title: Slide the "Show lock screen background picture on the sign-in screen" switch to On .
steps.content: Slide the "Show lock screen background picture on the sign-in screen" switch to On . You may have to scroll down to see this option. This ensures that the image(s) you selected will show not only on the lock screen, but also when you log in. [1] X Research source If you want to change your account photo, which appears on the lock screen, you can do so in Settings by clicking Accounts and then choosing an option under "Create your picture."

steps.title: Press ⊞ Win+C to open the Charms menu.
steps.content: Press ⊞ Win + C to open the Charms menu. You can also do this by swiping in from the right side of the screen, or by hovering the mouse in the screen's top-right corner. It's not possible to change the image that appears in the background of the Windows 8.1 login screen, but you can change the background of the lock screen, which appears before you enter your login information. This method will help you change the background of the lock screen.

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . It's the button with a gear on it at the bottom of the Charms Bar.

steps.title: Click Change PC settings.
steps.content: Click Change PC settings . This option is in the bottom-right corner of the screen.

steps.title: Click the Personalize tab.
steps.content: Click the Personalize tab. It's in the left panel.

steps.title: Click the Lock screen tab.
steps.content: Click the Lock screen tab. It's near the top of the Personalize window. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Click Browse.
steps.content: Click Browse . You should see this option below the row of demonstration photos in the middle of the page. You can also click on one of the demo photos to set it as your PC's lock screen.

steps.title: Select an image.
steps.content: Select an image. This can be any photo on your computer, although a high-resolution photo will look better on the lock screen than will a low-resolution one.

steps.title: Click Choose Image.
steps.content: Click Choose Image . It's at the bottom-right corner of the window. Doing so will set the photo as your PC's lock screen image, which is where you enter your password to log in.
